html: 8.23.17  1:40 pm   why does anyone even bother with capitalization. i feel like we know which words are important if we can read. is it just for people who can't read? i mean, punctuation actually changes the meanings and inflections of a sentence, but capitalization is just this thing that wants me to pay attention to some words more than others, and that's lame because words are all of equal vitality.

8.22.17  1:00 pm   Hi Bill. Something strange happened to me last night. I had this feeling that I just really wanted to lay down and close my eyes. The more time that passed the harder it was to keep my eyes open... I finally closed them. Next thing I remember, I open my eyes to find that it was about 8 hours later. And I have no recollection  of those 8 hours passing... but I felt oddly refreshed. What happened?

8.22.17  10:01 am   i tried to find everything i've ever written; stories, fictions, novel ideas, lyrics, text roleplays, one-shots, prompts, poems and even the stupid weird, you know, "things" from primary school. i gathered all of them and checked them over to see if they are useful, to take the good ones and finish projects.
after all this time i didn't write anything but a scenario for a school play, probably because it destroyed my whole life and i gave everything i had to it (i thought it would be a simple and small play since we do it for school but since i always want to do everything perfect, i somehow kinda became the director and wrote 13000 fucking words, with history researching, songs, stage decor, costumes, lighting etc it took 7 damn months of my life and i even fucking translated a nurse's journal and a soldier's war letters in Ottoman Turkish which was simply Arabic, a language that i don't know, for play to be realistic), i hoped reading m y old wo rks would make me do something.
it didn't. i don't know why i stopped doing what i do best. maybe i was tired and no matter what i do, i can't encourage myself to start again but i have to. it's not about inspiration, i am always creative but sometimes power of imagination is too much and i feel like i'm going insane. i want to write about whole universe(s) but i can't, and possibilities every little thing creates...
so this is the situation. i am sorry, it's long but i needed to tell. and the question is: should i complete my old projects, creating in a small scale like you said or should i go after the one i have always wanted to do which can change my life by starting all over? there is another choice, i can use my good works for beginning that big project but i'm so fucking afraid that i'll never be able to finish it.
